etymology.description: 胸大 (big chest) + 无脑 (brainless) = derogatory label implying attractiveness without intelligence.
etymology.interpretation: A pejorative internet slang phrase stereotyping women as busty but unintelligent; often considered sexist and insulting.
etymology.simplification: 无 and 脑 are simplified from 無 and 腦 to reduce stroke count; the body-part radical 月 is retained while complex components were streamlined in PRC orthographic reform.

examples.chinese: 她被贴上“胸大无脑”的标签(她被貼上「胸大無腦」的標籤)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bèi tiē shàng “xiōng dà wú nǎo” de biāoqiān.

examples.chinese: 这种说法带有性别歧视，不应随便使用(這種說法帶有性別歧視，不應隨便使用)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng shuōfǎ dàiyǒu xìngbié qíshì, bù yīng suíbiàn shǐyòng.
examples.english: This expression is sexist and shouldn’t be used casually.

examples.chinese: 有人反驳说能力与身材无关(有人反駁說能力與身材無關)。
examples.pinyin: Yǒu rén fǎnbó shuō nénglì yǔ shēncái wúguān.
examples.english: Some argue that ability has nothing to do with body shape.
